snippet: Philippe Vergne said his first priority in rebuilding the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles is to find a chief curator.
abstract: Philippe Vergne, DIA Art Foundation director who has been appointed to lead Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles, says his first priority in rebuilding museum is to hire a chief curator.

byline.original: By RANDY KENNEDY and JORI FINKEL
byline.contributor: Randy Kennedy reported from New York and Jori Finkel from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Philippe Vergne said his first priority in rebuilding the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles is to find a chief curator.

headline.main: Let Curators Be Curators, MOCA’s New Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Let Curators Be Curators, Museum’s New Chief Says

keywords.value: Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art
keywords.name: organizations
